main event: Multiple witnesses in Dayton, Ohio, reported sighting unidentified luminous objects on 3rd August 1953, at approximately 2100 - 2200 hours. The objects were observed hovering, changing direction, and then disappearing in a gradual curve.
interesting points: The objects were described as larger than most stars and brighter than a planet.
A witness described an object floating up, getting real bright, then gradually disappearing in a northeast direction.
The witnesses noticed that the objects appeared to be about 2 miles away, traveling rapidly before stopping.
One witness observed an object that appeared to change colors and brightness before fading away.
The objects were observed making rapid circular and straight upward movements before disappearing.
witnesses: Multiple witnesses, including civilian and military personnel
photographs: no photographs available in the report
